item.title: Outerloop Games lays off multiple employees
item.content:encoded:
Image via Outerloop Games/Annapurna Interactive.

Thirsty Suitors and Dosa Divas developer Outerloop Games is laying off six developers after facing unexpected financial challenges.

Word of these layoffs first spread on LinkedIn, where a number of affected workers shared their employment status. Outerloop Games CEO Chandana Ekanayake then confirmed the layoffs in a statement to Game Developer and on social media.

"We're saying goodbye to six wonderful folks on our team this week at Outer Loop Games," Ekanayake said in the statement. "They've been part of the team for years and unfortunately we got hit with some unexpected US tax changes, a port cancellation, and new project pitches that are going slow. It's a rough year."

Ekanayake said the company is finishing development on Dosa Divas and pitching two smaller projects. He also provided a public spreadsheet with information from the affected employees in the hopes other developers can reach out to provide work.

"They're all very talented and collaborative," he noted in a follow-up post.

It's unclear if Outerloop was impacted by the drastic 2024 turnover at Annapurna Interactive, which is publishing Dosa Divas. In September of that year, all of its employees resigned, shortly reuniting to take over Take-Two Interactive's shut-down publishing label Private Division.
